Metadata.Title: RHSA-2022:7950: Image Builder security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Low)
Metadata.Description:
Image Builder is a service for building customized OS artifacts, such as VM images and OSTree commits, that uses osbuild under the hood.

Security Fix(es):

* golang: math/big: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service (CVE-2022-32189)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.1 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Criterions.Comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
weldr-client is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
